entries.title: Justice Department’s Antitrust Chief Leaves Post
Border czar Tom Homan said the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown in Minnesota is ending and immigration officials will be winding down operations in the state
In Miami Beach, Fla., a flood-resistant home under construction on Biscayne Bay is going on the market for $85 million.
Josh Gruenbaum’s brash ways as a federal agency bean-counter earned him the trust of Jared Kushner and Trump’s foreign policy team—and sparked an inquiry into whether he broke contracting rules
What a shutdown would mean for the Department of Homeland Security, which includes not only border agents but also airport security officers and emergency management functions
California Gov. Gavin Newsom is on the road again, to the Munich Security Conference. Will he troll President Trump there—as he did at Davos? Read more in today’s WSJ Politics Newsletter:
President Trump lashed out at GOP Gov. Kevin Stitt of Oklahoma, lobbing his latest criticism of a fellow Republican
The GOP-led House passed a resolution designed to roll back President Trump’s tariffs on Canada, as six Republicans joined Democrats in rebuking the administration’s signature economic policy
At a congressional hearing, Attorney General Pam Bondi declined to apologize directly to a group of Jeffrey Epstein’s victims who were seated behind her
The U.S. budget deficit will widen over the next decade as interest costs consume an increasing share of spending, CBO says

House lawmakers rejected an attempt by Speaker Mike Johnson to block votes on resolutions disapproving of President Trump’s tariffs—paving the way for lawmakers to rebuke Trump’s signature economic policy
The Republican-led House passed legislation that would tighten federal voter registration requirements, advancing one of the party’s longstanding election priorities over the objections of Democrats
Unsealed document shows role Kurt Olsen, hired by the White House to investigation election fraud claims, played in spurring search of Georgia office.
President Trump’s effort to push Republican state lawmakers to create more GOP-favorable House districts is on track to yield far fewer gains than expected

Five reasons Republicans are worried about this Texas state Senate race
The Pentagon has told a second aircraft carrier strike group to prepare to deploy to the Middle East as the U.S. military prepares for a potential attack on Iran, according to three U.S. officials
The Pentagon has warned defense contractors to brace for sweeping performance reviews that will identify companies it says aren’t fulfilling their contracts
Whistleblower complaint against Tulsi Gabbard is based on U.S.-intercepted phone conversation in which individuals linked to a foreign government discussed a person close to President Trump
The Trump administration announced a new strategy for overseas arms sales that is centered on boosting the manufacture of weapons most important to the U.S. military
President Trump announced that he wants the U.S. to negotiate a new strategic arms treaty following the lapse of the last major nuclear pact with Russia
